alert.note: Alert for Kimble; Mason (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS San Angelo (Central Texas San Angelo)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued September 24 at 6:12PM CDT by NWS San Angelo
info.description: ...A STRONG THUNDERSTORM WILL IMPACT NORTHEASTERN KIMBLE AND SOUTHWESTERN MASON COUNTIES THROUGH 700 PM CDT... At 612 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Us-377 Near The Kimble- Menard County Line, or near Long Mountain, moving southeast at 20 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and nickel size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor hail damage to vegetation is possible. Locations impacted include... Hedwigs Hill and Streeter. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.88 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 1100 PM CDT for west central Texas.
